result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Krakow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to each other.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $500 pornography surcharge on Count #1

--to Register and Report as a Sex Offender
--to undergo Sex Offender evaluation and follow through with all recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
-- to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program 
--no contact with any child/any person under age 18
--no possession of any cellphone, computer, or other electronic device capable of accessing the Internet; the Court clarifies that Mr. Krakow may have a cellphone as long as it does not have internet-access capability, as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: DOJ

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

[MK] case called at 3:35pm. 
Defendant Charles A. Krakow in court with Attorney Philip J. Brehm.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  Guilty  " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Krakow guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #4 through #10.  

On Counts #1, #2 and #3 each, the Court sentences Mr. Krakow to  8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent on each other. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to Register and Report as a Sex Offender
--to undergo Sex Offender evaluation and follow through with all recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program 
--no contact with any child/any person under age 18
--no possession of any cellphone, computer, or other electronic device capable of accessing the Internet; the Court clarifies that Mr. Krakow may have a cellphone as long as it does not have internet-access capability, as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $500 pornography surcharge on Count #1
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $500 pornography surcharge on Count #2
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge plus $500 pornography surcharge on Count #3


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 3:52pm
for continuance of the FSSC & JT

Pleas of "not guilty" entered

Counsel agree 2 days is needed for trial

Recess: 8:39 am

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:01am [mo]
Defendant Charles A. Krakow in court with Attorney Philip J. Brehm.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Brehm presents a substitution to the Court.
The Court finds that this request has been made timely.
The Court finds that it no longer has jurisdiction over this case. The Court directs the Clerk to take appropriate steps to appoint new Court to this case.

recess:9:03am

[MK] case called at 9:40am. 
Defendant Charles A. Krakow in court with Attorney Philip J. Brehm.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding victim rights compliance, ADA Teuber indicates that this is a victim-less crime.  
Mr. Krakow waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
On request of Attorney Brehm, the Court schedules Arraignment on a later date. 
recess 9:422am. 

NEXT:  Arraignment on July 20th at 9:00am.
Attorney Phillip Brehm with Cover Letter
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Letter from the defendant updating his phone number
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 1:31-pm. [mo]
Defendant Charles A. Krakow appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Krakow does not qualify for PD representation
Right to Counsel given


Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
 Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $100,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--not to possess any smart phone, computer, or other device that is capable of accessing the Internet
--not to access the Internet
--not possess any type of pornography
--no contact with any person under the age of 18, except for incidental contact in public
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:43  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference: May 20, 2015 at 1:00pm   (2) Status Conference: June 9, 2015 at 9:30am
